name: 2,2-Dimethyl-5-[(5-phenyl-2-furyl)methylene]-1,3-dioxane-4,6-dione
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-3893
Reason: The melting point of 2,2-Dimethyl-5-[(5-phenyl-2-furyl)methylene]-1,3-dioxane-4,6-dione can be predicted by considering the functional groups present in the molecule. The dioxane ring itself has a melting point of around 10°C, due to its planarity and rigidity. The methylene group attached to the dioxane ring adds +20°C due to increased molecular weight and van der Waals interactions. The phenyl group contributes +60°C due to its electronegativity and increased molecular weight. The furan ring adds +40°C due to its increased molecular weight and potential for hydrogen bonding. The overall effect of the conjugation and aromaticity within the molecule is estimated to be +10°C.
